title: Which of the following songs will rank highest on the Billboard Hot 100 for the week of 21 May 2022?
possible_answers: Stay, The Kid LAROI & Justin Bieber
preds: Looks like Jack Harlow is claiming the spot for this week.

Not knowing any of the songs, my guess is based solely on my fictional self being a label executive who needs to place a bet without any further information. Don't feel like editing because of the crowd forecast obviously showing i would have lost the gamble.

As it Was by Harry Styles is going to be the number song on the Billboard Top 100. My reasoning behind this is that right now on the social media app TikTok, the song is becoming very popular with influencers continuously using the song for the past couple of days. However, the reason why it is not so high is that the charts are very inconsistent. The majority of the songs on the charts are popular due to social media apps, however, the song As it Was is on the rise at the moment. The other songs have not had a rise on the charts or do not reach the expectations of listeners, for instance, although Jack Harlow released First Class, the expectation of the album was not there. Additionally, Glass Animals by Heat Waves, although catchy, has been around for roughly two years. The same goes with STAY by The Kid LAROI and Enemy by Imagine Dragons. However, As it Was leads the expecatations and I believe will be the most likely to be the highest.

There is a possibility that all five of these songs will not be featured as the top song of the following week, with Future's release, along with the steady release of contemporary music throughout this week, the potential result of this poll is in ambiguity. We are favoring Harry Styles release, as of the writing of this he is ranked #2 and is likely to receive attention from radio given that he is one of the most successful modern pop artists, and he has a new movie he's starring in that will attract plenty of crowds which could therefore boost the music. Stay and Enemy we ranked around the same percentile, with a slight edge to Stay given that it features two artists. Anything can happen

Updating to cater for post-release charting.

"As It Was" was number 1 this week. Ranked #3 last week and has been on the charts for 4 weeks.  "First Class" ranked 2 this week. It ranked 1 last week and has been on the charts for 3 weeks. "Enemy" ranked 5 this week and last week, on the charts for 23 weeks. 5 was its peak position. "Heat Waves" ranks 3 this week and last week, on the charts for 67 weeks Stay ranks 6 this week and last week, on the charts for 42.  - As it Was, First Class, Heat Waves and Stay are the top songs in Spotify Global charts.  - As it Was and First Class are the top two songs in the US Spotify charts, followed by other songs not listed.  **** Wondering if there should be an other category for this question *****
Styles is losing plays faster on the american spotify charts than Harlow.

Harry's song sounds a little more smooth.  I think we need that sense of polish, control, and reassurance right now.    But then again, sad songs get much more repeat playtime on playslists (like 5x!)....so maybe our inner Bielibers will emerge.

Based on popularity I think Harry Styles song "As it was" will rank higher on the Billboard hot 100 for the week of 21 May 2022. I assume this because Harry styles will be dropping an album soon and that will give him more popularity and more chances to rank higher on the Billboard Hot 100.

Based on past chart performance, this is between Bieber and Styles. Stay was released last year and peaked in April this year. As It Was has just been released so has more potential, and Styles has been all over youtube with live performances at festivals recently. There's still a chance that Bieber will still be ahead of Styles, whose Billboard positions have not been good as a solo artist.
current top two are newest on the chart and only swapped places this week

Frankly speaking, all of the above mentioned "pieces of music" are real idle worthless BS sadly produced exactly for a certain niche target group of interest (age, sexual orientation, leisure activity, former name recognition, ...) optimized for limited sound replay capacities of a modern mobile phone and cheated with melody patterns for immediate brand recognition. Today's artistry consists of (i) having a foot in the door with the industry (ii) be willing to sell your soul (incl. life) to some people in exchange for short-lived popularity (iii) chosing an up-to-date producer with state-of-the-art software & samples, beats library and, finally,  (iv) good command of AutoTune and the likes. And in post-production, (v) never mess with Apple Inc. If there was a real choice, I'd add this song/performance as bin 6 https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x20n7u and credit it with 100% in memory of Taylor Hawkins.  Turning to the limited choice on offer, it seems like Harry Styles will make it /because of his most recent success on the US market far beyond his home market in UK, see Watermelon Sugar (2020) if you put the non-starter Golden aside, and /because his image is perfectly fabricated and designed and positioned to meet the needs of a broad and engaged audience with a high willingness-to-pay which is a good support for sustained sales for at least 10 to 15 weeks. The perfect product for today's zeitgeist, weltschmerz, emptiness reflecting a sad & lonely generation living in the past and eternal childhood. Even the sound heavily mimicks European 1980's (see e.g. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=djV11Xbc914 | https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Take_On_Me#Chart_performance ).
